ygData.subject: RE: Level times
ygData.msgSnippet: I am not really in a great hurry, but I like to see my character advance. The RP aspects of this game are about 1/10th of UO s even though that game was
ygData.messageBody:
I am not really in a great hurry, but I like to see
my character advance. The RP aspects of this game are
about 1/10th of UO's even though that game was riddled
with Player Killers, bugs and exploits. I enjoy the
game, but I feel after playing similar game types that
this game corrals you more into the powergamer role.

I get into the mindset that I can play this game for a
few hours and be about the same as I started or I can
play something like Heroes of Might and Magic III and
go through a few scenarios.

I will more likely plan to leave due to slow leveling
than I would if I would see constant improvements in
my character.

Even level 50s still have to go in two full groups to
take on the tougher stuff like the dragons.

Belgarth Wolfstrider

--- seekerslady@... wrote:
> From: seekerslady@...
>
> I used to play meridian 59. I loved this game but
> people got burned out on
> it becuase you could build too fast and then got
> bored. Then people went
> around and PKed each other. It turned a wonderful
> online community into a
> garbage dump. What is your great hurry? You planning
> on leaving soon? As
> long as you are having fun and meeting new people
> and playing a game you
> like what difference does it make what level you are
> or how fast you get
> there. These games are ment to be played for years
> not weeks. I am
> surprised that people have already been able to max
> out. Now what do they
> have to do? Ok they can go anywhere and kill almost
> anything but how long
> before they get bored and move on? The game has only
> been out a few months.
>
> Just my 2 cents
>
> Feather Dreamwalker of Rathe
> >
> >I agree that level gaining is quite slow. 8-10
> hours
> >for a level is a bit much. I can't imagine the high
> >30s and above.
> >
> >Belgarth
